messages.subject: Re: WOW help
messages.msgSnippet: My son says there is good and bad to playing on private server-- you get to be higher level real quick but it is mostly an anything goes place with no oversite
messages.messageBody:
My son says there is good and bad to playing on private server-- you
get to be higher level real quick but it is mostly an anything goes
place with no oversite or game rules. More of a free for all but you
get to be a 70 and try out the high level stuff without being a high
level.


--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "mascire2" <amiersa2@...>
wrote:
>
> Just wondering if anyone knows anything about playing WOW on a
private
> server? Eric says that he played on one at the conference on
someone
> else's computer. I don't know enough about this, and I don't know
what
> information on google to go by, or if it is even allowed. I feel
so
> ignorant about this game. Every time I think I am learning,
something
> else comes along, and I am lost again!
> Thanks for any help!
>
> Amie
>
> "What would it be like if you lived each day, each breath, as a
work of
> art in progress? Imagine that you are a masterpiece unfolding,
every
> second of every day, a work of art taking form with every breath."
> ~Thomas Crum
>

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] WOW help
messages.msgSnippet: From what I understand, it s legal to make your own private server (for yourself only) if you own a copy of the game, but you cannot legally create a server
messages.messageBody:
From what I understand, it's legal to make your own private server (for
yourself only) if you own a copy of the game, but you cannot legally create
a server that other people can play on.
Jess

messages.subject: WOW help
messages.msgSnippet: Just wondering if anyone knows anything about playing WOW on a private server? Eric says that he played on one at the conference on someone else s computer. I
messages.messageBody:
Just wondering if anyone knows anything about playing WOW on a private
server? Eric says that he played on one at the conference on someone
else's computer. I don't know enough about this, and I don't know what
information on google to go by, or if it is even allowed. I feel so
ignorant about this game. Every time I think I am learning, something
else comes along, and I am lost again!
Thanks for any help!

Amie

"What would it be like if you lived each day, each breath, as a work of
art in progress? Imagine that you are a masterpiece unfolding, every
second of every day, a work of art taking form with every breath."
~Thomas Crum
